metadata.title: CVE-2018-11203 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A division by zero was discovered in H5D__btree_decode_key in H5Dbtree.c inthe HDF HDF5 1.10.2 library. It could allow a remote denial of serviceattack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-11203` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

hdf5-helpers - 1.10.4+repack-11ubuntu1
hdf5-tools - 1.10.4+repack-11ubuntu1
libhdf5-103 - 1.10.4+repack-11ubuntu1
libhdf5-cpp-103 - 1.10.4+repack-11ubuntu1
libhdf5-java - 1.10.4+repack-11ubuntu1
libhdf5-jni - 1.10.4+repack-11ubuntu1
libhdf5-mpich-103 - 1.10.4+repack-11ubuntu1
libhdf5-openmpi-103 - 1.10.4+repack-11ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: hdf5 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.4+repack-11ubuntu1').
